Onions and garlic will add a wonderful depth of flavor to the roasted carrots. 

For the ginger, you can use either fresh or ground ginger, depending on your personal preference and the flavor profile you're aiming for. Here are some suggestions:

**Fresh Ginger:**

* Use about 2-3 inches (5-7.5 cm) of fresh ginger, peeled and grated or sliced thinly.
* Add the fresh ginger to the pot along with the roasted carrots, onions, and garlic.
* Fresh ginger will give your soup a bright, spicy, and refreshing flavor.

**Ground Ginger:**

* Use about 1-2 teaspoons of ground ginger, depending on your desired level of spiciness.
* Add the ground ginger to the pot towards the end of the simmering time, so the flavors can meld together.
* Ground ginger will provide a more subtle, warm, and comforting flavor to the soup.

If you want a stronger ginger flavor, you can use a combination of both fresh and ground ginger. For example, add sliced fresh ginger to the pot during the simmering process and then stir in some ground ginger towards the end.

When choosing fresh ginger, look for pieces with smooth, firm skin and a spicy aroma. You can store fresh ginger in the refrigerator for up to a week or freeze it for up to 3 months.

Remember to adjust the amount of ginger according to your personal taste preferences. Some people prefer a subtle ginger flavor, while others like it more pronounced.

Now that we have the ingredients and roasting plan in place, are you ready to start making your Creamy Carrot and Ginger Soup?
